1.text: Use a suede brush or toothbrush to remove dirt and debris.

2.text: Avoid machine washing or spot-cleaning your slippers with water.

3.text: Apply suede protector spray to your slippers to help keep them clean.

4.text: Clean your suede slippers as often as you can.

5.text: Try using baking soda to remove fresh stains on your slippers.

6.text: Use an eraser to buff out stains that have already set.

7.text: Apply white vinegar to extra-stubborn stains.

8.text: Try using white chalk or cornstarch to remove grease and oil stains.

9.text: Use a commercial suede stain remover if other methods aren’t helping.

10.text: Take your slippers to a cobbler if you can’t get the stains out on your own.

11.text: Wipe down the inner lining of your slippers with a baby wipe.

12.text: Sprinkle baking soda inside your slippers to get rid of bad odors.

13.text: Spray a commercial deodorizer inside your slippers for stubborn smells.
